guideline.name: Annotation of DPWG Guideline for tamoxifen and CYP2D6

relatedGenes.name: cytochrome P450 family 2 subfamily D member 6

recommendations.name: Recommendation Annotation PA166302762

text.html: The guideline does not provide a recommendation for tamoxifen in normal metabolizers.

implications: The guideline does not provide a description of the impact of a normal metabolizer phenotype on tamoxifen.

recommendations.name: Recommendation Annotation PA166302766

text.html: NO action is needed for this gene-drug interaction.

implications: As a result of the genetic variation, the plasma concentration of the active metabolites 4-hydroxytamoxifen and endoxifen can increase. However, there is no evidence that this results in an increase in the side effects.

recommendations.name: Recommendation Annotation PA166302842

text.html: NO action is needed for this gene-drug interaction.

implications: As a result of the genetic variation, the plasma concentration of the active metabolites 4-hydroxytamoxifen and endoxifen can increase. However, there is no evidence that this results in an increase in the side effects.

recommendations.name: Recommendation Annotation PA166302744

text.html:
• Select an alternative or measure the endoxifen concentration and increase the dose if necessary, by a factor of 1.5-2. Aromatase inhibitors are a possible alternative for post-menopausal women.
  • If TAMOXIFEN is selected: avoid co-medication with CYP2D6 inhibitors such as paroxetine and fluoxetine.

implications: This gene variation reduces the conversion of tamoxifen to the active metabolite endoxifen. This can result in reduced effectiveness.

recommendations.name: Recommendation Annotation PA166302726

text.html: Select an alternative or increase the dose to 40 mg/day and monitor the endoxifen concentration. Studies have demonstrated that PM can achieve an adequate endoxifen concentration when the dose is increased to 40-60 mg/day. Aromatase inhibitors are a possible alternative for post-menopausal women.

implications: This gene variation reduces the conversion of tamoxifen to the active metabolite endoxifen. This can result in reduced effectiveness.

citations.title: Pharmacogenetics: from bench to byte--an update of guidelines.
